node.title: Rich or Spiritual – Why Not Both?
node.description:
Being spiritual and being wealthy aren’t mutually exclusive. In fact, it can even be one and the same.

Some people have a preconceived notion that if you are chasing riches, you can’t possibly be spiritual. It’s this stigma towards money that blocks them from achieving their maximum potential. The truth of the matter is that if you have financial freedom, you are free to pursue your spiritual path and serve a higher purpose. At the same time, spirituality can give you the drive to generate more income.

If you find this concept strange and confusing, watch this video until the end. I’ll be sharing with you the link between wealth and spirituality; a balance that most people seem to miss out. Like Yin and Yang, these two opposite forces actually complement one another and can generate greater results in your life.

If you’re curious to know how you can use Qi Men Dun Jia to align these goals together, join my FREE 4-day live training that’s coming up soon. You can find more details by using the following link: http://www.joeyyap.com/qimen-manifestation

node.title: How To Get To Where You Want To Be
node.description:
In life, there’s where we are now and where we wanted to be.

While a lot of people don’t really know what their ultimate goal is, some people can see what they wish to achieve. The only problem is they have no idea how to fill in the gaps in between. They don’t even know where to begin or what steps to take in order to make their dream a reality. However, Qi Men Dun Jia might just be the bridge that will get you there.

QiMen forecasting gives you an overview of your current circumstances. It take into account all the external forces that influences your decisions, the obstacles in your way and the opportunities that will speed up the process. In other words, it’s a treasure map that can potentially show you the step-by-step process that can lead you to your ultimate dream.

Interested to see QiMen forecasting in action? I’ll be conducting a FREE 4-day live training soon. You can find more details and join the training by using the following link: http://www.joeyyap.com/qimen-manifestation.

node.title: What do people use QiMen For?
node.description:
Among the various tools used in Chinese Metaphysics, Qi Men Dun Jia is arguably is one of the most versatile.

Predating BaZi and Feng Shui, this art has been developed for various purposes over the centuries. Its main purpose can be described as a tool that helps you make better decisions in life, identify opportunities you would otherwise have missed and execute the right strategy for any occasion. It’s no surprise that it’s the secret weapon of ancient generals and business tycoons alike.

If you’re wondering what exactly can QiMen do for you, watch this video all the way. I’ll be sharing with you the 3 practical ways that it can enhance your life. Thanks to its rich utility and in-built versatility, Qi Men Dun Jia is a truly a timeless system that can be used to tackle the problems of today. If you want something that’s guaranteed to deliver immediate results, this is it.

Would you like to know how you can get started with QiMen? I’ll be conducting a FREE 4-day live training soon on the subject. You can find more details and join the training by using the following link: http://www.joeyyap.com/qimen-manifestation

node.title: A Map To See The Unseen In Your Business
node.description:
Not everyone is born to be a successful business owner, but anyone can learn how to do it.

After over two decades in this industry doing consultations for high-profile clients, it goes without saying that there are several things I’ve noticed. Almost all of these people who are successful business owners have these 4 factors in common that has gotten them to where they are today. Using Qi Men Dun Jia, you too can uncover the ingredients for a successful business.

QiMen is a multi-purpose system that can be used in all kinds of scenarios. In each instances, the focal point of the Deities, Stars, Doors and Stem represent different aspects depending on the context. If you’re planning to use it for business and wealth, watch this video until the end to see how it’s done.

node.title: The 3 Types Of Action That Will Get You Out of A Crisis
node.description:
If you’re feeling a little lost right now, you’re not alone. A lot of people are still reeling from the effects of the pandemic crisis and struggle in the face of the new norm.

You may have not asked to be in this circumstance, but it’s your responsibility to get yourself out of it. All it takes is the courage and resolve to take the first step.

The big changes you want doesn’t happen overnight. It’s a step-by-step process, and it gets easier along the way as you gain more and more momentum.

Have you taken the first step out of crisis? Let me know in the comments below and let’s help to encourage more people to get back on their feet.

node.title: Qi = Life Energy
node.description:
The environment plays a vital role in shaping your internal world. Everywhere around us, there is an invisible energy field called Qi that permeates in everything.

Qi, also known as life force energy, is what keeps everything running. At its core, authentic Feng Shui is the art of understanding and enhancing this energy.

In this video, I'll be explaining to you the concept of life force energy and how you can benefit from it. The environment affects you more than you think.

Have you ever felt the effects of positive life force energy before? Share your experience in the comments below and tell me how it felt for you.

node.title: If Wealth Is A Form Of Energy, How Do You Harness It?
node.description:
Feng Shui is an art that can transform your life for the better. It can help you make better decision, have better health and improve your overall well-being.

If it is capable to do a lot of things, why is it always associated with wealth?

It is a fact that many people began learning Feng Shui to improve the financial aspect of their life. However, not a lot of people truly understand HOW Feng Shui can help you with that.

In this video, I’ll be making the connection between Feng Shui and wealth so that you may have a better understanding on this subject.

Have your wealth improved thanks to Feng Shui? Let me know in the comments below.

node.title: 2021 Chinese Astrology Outlook + 12 Animals Forecast | Joey Yap
node.description:
Want to be fully prepared for 2021? 

Change is good, but only if you’re expecting it. The right information can help you thrive even in challenging times. To thrive is to prosper, to be fortunate and successful. And as a result, to grow, to develop rigorously and to flourish as a person not just in wealth, but in wisdom.  

We’ve prepared this summary forecast video to help prepare and serve you as a guide for the upcoming Chinese New Year. If you’re looking to make 2021 a PIVOTAL YEAR, and you want to: 

✔️  Find new ways of self-expression

✔️  Increase your personal power 

✔️  Improve your interpersonal relationships

✔️  Attain a new level of self-awareness 

✔️  Have the courage to finally move forward 

Then this video is absolutely for you! 


=============================================
IF YOU THINK THIS IS A PREDICTION, YOU ARE WRONG! 
=============================================

One thing that gets on my nerve is that Astrology is used the wrong way. Predictions imply that nothing can be changed and everything is fated. To me, that’s kind of sad. Life isn’t fatalistic. 

Life is about choices. 

Chinese Astrology or for that matter, any form of astrology is about reading the energy maps that influence all living beings. To be more specific, what kind of stars affect us on Earth (in Western Astrology it’s just called planets or constellations while for the ancient Chinese astrologers, they chose farm animals and mythical creatures so that it’s relatable to peasants who were usually deprived of any formal education).  

But how can planets so far away affect our ‘luck’? 

It’s simple. Here are 2 examples:

1. Heard of lunatics? It refers to a crazy person who becomes crazier during full moons or ‘moonstruck’. Basically, it amplifies our emotions or who we are. 
 
2. The Sun – can you imagine the kind of day you’d have without one? 

We’re not mechanical beings. We’re spiritual beings – mind, body and soul. Luck or Wealth is just a form of energy. We can’t see this energy (referred to as Qi in Chinese Astrology and Metaphysics) nor do we need to. Just like Electrons – no one has ever seen it, but we all know it’s there. And the reason we know Electrons exists is because we observe it’s effects. Feng Shui, Chinese Astrology and Metaphysics works the same way within these boundaries. 

If you’d like to explore more topics, here are 3 things you can do right away (and they are all FREE):


1. Download the Thriver’s Guide here: http://www.joeyyap.com/2021

2. Join my Telegram channel, I post a lot of free training, tips and table talk topics here: http://www.joeyyap.com/telegram 

3. Subscribe to this YouTube Channel, binge watch the videos. It’s the best place to start your journey: http://www.joeyyap.com/youtube 

=============================================
WAIT, THERE’S MORE….. 
=============================================

Want a more detailed forecast of EACH of the 12 ANIMAL SIGNS? Click on any of the links below (I will update them as I release each video). Or you can just subscribe to this channel and HIT THE BELL ICON so that you automatically get notified when it’s released.

node.title: Activating the God of Wealth Sector on 5 February 2019
node.description:
Method to usher the Wealth of God or simply wishes that you want to be able to achieve in 2019 Year of the Pig. The sector and time is researched using the astrological stars and planet position.

1) Prepare a piece of paper and pen.

2) On 5 February 2019 115pm, face the SouthWest

3) Some of you want to use this sector receive the God of Wealth (Cai Sheng), you are welcome to setup your altar and offer your prayers. (For those that are not doing any worshiping, skip this step)

4) Write your full name, and up to 6 wishes that you want it to be accomplished in 2019. (Remember the wish must be something you can accomplished and within your capacity. *eg. I want a billion dollar in my account overnight is not going to work)

5) When you are done, focus your intention on these 6 wishes and send them out to the Universe.

Share with your loved ones, so we can all have a great 2019!

node.title: Jan Cisek: Spiritual Feng Shui, 10 July 2021, FSS Conference
node.description:
Jan Cisek: Spiritual Feng Shui, 10 July 2021, FSS Conference
More infoL https://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/speakers-2/

Feng shui works on many levels, from physical to emotional to mental and to spiritual. Spiritual feng shui deals with the spiritual and transpersonal environmental aspects of individuals or organisations.

In classical and modern feng shui, humans are placed between heaven (spiritual/transpersonal/virtual) and earth (material) dimensions as part of the trinity of luck: heaven’s luck (spiritual), human luck (your skills, mindsets, beliefs, etc.) and earth luck (feng shui). Initially, when feng shui was conceived, it was considered as a spiritual discipline because it was used for sitting for burial places, so the ancestors’ spirits could rest in peace. Modern feng shui aligns itself with modern spirituality and transpersonal psychology in a holistic understanding of the interaction between environments and individuals.

Research (Koenig, 2012) suggests that when people have organised their homes or workspaces with spiritual understanding and connection, they feel better, are happier and healthier. Some of the research refers to creating sacred spaces for peace, harmony and wellness. In May 1984, the Thirty-Seven World Health Assembly adopted resolution WHA37.13, which made the ‘spiritual dimension’ part and parcel of WHO Member States’ strategies for health.

Spiritual feng shui is to help you connect with spiritual and transpersonal dimensions and realms and anchor them in your home or workplace. The function of spiritual feng shui is to remind you to balance your personal needs with your spiritual and transpersonal needs to create more connection, peace of mind as well as care and compassion.
More infoL https://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/speakers-2/

node.title: Diane Shillito: Art And Its Influence On The Canvas Of Your Home, 10 July 2021 FSS Conference
node.description:
Diane Shillito Art And Its Influence On The Canvas Of Your Home.
More info: https://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/speakers-2/

Diane will talk about home as a canvas and the potential and language of imagery and symbolism to create possibility. In the context of Feng Shui, how do we include imagery effectively to support our lives? What is it’s cause and effect? The veiled language of art can influence perception, space and time to enhance any environment. Yet how do we select imagery when it can be a very personal choice?
More info: https://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/speakers-2/

node.title: Stephen Skinner: What you didn’t know about Eight Mansion Feng Shui, 10 July 2021 FSS Conference
node.description:
Stephen Skinner: What you didn’t know about Eight Mansion Feng Shui
More info: https://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/speakers-2/

“Eight Mansion Feng Shui (sometimes called East Groups/West Groups) is a method that has many uses. At a macro level, it enables you to rapidly select the best properties from a selection of properties that you might be considering to rent or purchase. It gives clear rules for beneficially opening new doorways, or closing old ones (often a key change). Inside the house if gives directions for the best sleeping, sitting or studying positions, and best personal facing directions. It complements, but does not conflict with, Flying Star feng shui. It is a very versatile but somewhat underrated method, that in the past has not been fully taught.”
More info: https://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/speakers-2/

node.title: Vicky Sweetlove "Feng Shui Alchemy of your Home and You" 10 July 2021 FSS Conference
node.description:
Vicky Sweetlove "Feng Shui Alchemy of your Home and You" speaking at the FSS conference 2021.

More info about the FSS conference https://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/speakers-2/

The energy of our home is vital to the wellbeing of everyone who lives there. If we do not feel energetically 100% in ourselves. Then the home could be feeling out of balance and may well have an effect on how we feel and react in our work, relationships and health.

We connect to our home and its energy centres as we would with our own body’s energy centres.

Vicky will take you through the world’s energy centres and then show you examples of our home’s energy centres.

We are all drawn to our “special” places in the house where we like to sit, sleep, work and play, its where we feel comfortable and “at home”.

Vicky will walk you through the energies of the home and how you can locate the places, that need a lift, the ones that are balanced and the ones that you feel “wow” in. You will be able to go home and “know” where your energetic places are.

More info https://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/speakers-2/

node.title: Qi Men Dun Jia Remote Feng Shui - Key Points - Patricia Lee and Pamela Faye
node.description:
Patricia Lee is a professional consultant and educator based in the United States and works globally.  She is working on a prototype to devise coherent and effective strategies for the modern competitive world. Strategies derived from understanding how all the players are positioned on a chessboard. It uses an objective assessment of the playing field, optimal training and space to reinforce plan execution. It positions you to amplify outcomes of your actions. It merges the tools we are taught with the Art of War aspects that has long been adopted in the business and professional world.

Pamela Faye is a teacher, lecturer and professional consultant in the United States and abroad. Pamela's goal is to target her client's issue and assist them in achieving the goal they desire. Pamela Faye implements her research using Qi Men Dun Jia, date selection, Yi Ying, Xuan Kong Da Gua and strategies from the Art of War. Even though these tools have been used for centuries, many are not aware of them. Pamela is passionate about giving insight and solutions to transforming other's lives. Pamela stays true to her passion of service to others for over 30 years now.

node.title: Four pillars for health and well-being: finding your balance – Beth Grace, USA
node.description: Beth is an international Feng Shui and Chinese metaphysics consultant who has trained with masters in the United States and Asia. She is also a professional astrology who uses Bazi or four pillars astrology and Qi Men Dun Jia, to understand her clients, provide them with life guidance and for business coaching. In addition to Chinese geomancy and metaphysics, she also incorporates dowsing in her work for space clearing, earth energies and water location for well sites.

node.title: Qi Men Dun Jia Software and more - Krzysztof Pazowski, UK
node.description: Technology helps us to achieve results quicker, saves time and money. The online platform Chinese Metasoft is the Chinese Metaphysics hybrid connecting many techniques in one place, multilingual. Practitioners from various schools find the software customisable, fulfilling their needs. The website is famous from the extensive Qi Men Dun Jia charts and its search engine capabilities.  We will see how we can quickly find the special Qi Men Dun Jia structures, the technique which nowadays is applied to business and strategic planning.

node.title: Feng Shui, Chinese Medicine and Holistic health - Simon Brown
node.description:
A look at how feng shui influences the human body. Includes studying internal chi flow through the body, the meridians and how this is influenced by external factors. We explore the relationships between different parts of our home and organs / emotions, and the use of yin/yang and 5 elements as a therapy tool.

Simon Brown Bio
Simon is the best selling author of 9 feng shui books, including The Feng Shui Bible. He has carried out many long term feng shui projects including British Airways, The Body Shop, Paris T2G airport terminal, The Heron Tower, China Construction Bank and Mandali Spa Village near lake Orto. Simon teaches in Japan, India, Spain, Portugal, Sweden, Denmark, US and UK.

node.title: Traditional Feng Shui Decoded -  Feng Shui Master Dr Michael Oon, UK
node.description:
Traditional Feng Shui is a term that has been used frequently. What is it?

Is it a mystical or religious, logical or intuitive? Is it a craft or a body of knowledge for intellectuals? Is this how Feng Shui was practised 300 years ago in the Qing Dynasty or just another modern version? Is it practised by individuals or by a team?

Is it used for residential, commercial or infrastructure? Most importantly, does it work?

Michael Oon will decode the various aspects of Traditional Feng Shui by describing his journey in this Chinese Practice.

node.title: Taijiquan/Qigong  - Feng Shui Master and Architect Howard Choy, Germany
node.description: The main aim of this practice is to achieve self-awareness and full-body relaxation, so your five-senses and your heart/mind can be sharpened as an instrument to perceive the Qi of the environment.

node.title: Blending Hexagrams -  Feng Shui Master Alex Costa, Italy
node.description: The blending hexagrams is a talk, from which one can learn different ways to cross the knowledge of the Hexagrams from Mei Hua (Yi Jing divination) to Xuan Kong da Gua. In this talk three examples will be displayed: 1. find where the problems are coming from, using an easy divination technique. 2. find solutions using the 64 hexagrams. 3. break the boundaries in Chinese metaphysics system and find that QI has not limits.

node.title: How?  What?  Why? -  Feng Shui Master Mike Chester, UK
node.description:
Feng shui can be a very confusing subject to study. You may well have seen different books or heard teachers giving entirely contradictory advice about how certain methods should work or be applied: so how can you know which is right? If you have been studying for a while, then it is likely that you will have questions that nobody seems able to answer. Here is the chance to ask those burning questions that you would like answered.

With his years of experience and his pragmatic engineer’s viewpoint, Mike Chester will endeavour to give logical answers to the questions that you feel you would like to ask

Feng Shui Logos – How to Design Logos and Business Cards with Feng Shui Principles – Jan Cisek (UK)
node.description:
Feng Shui Logos – How to Design Logos and Business Cards with Feng Shui Principles – Jan Cisek (UK)
The 10th Feng Shui Society Conference 14-15 May 2016 London, UK
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

Having a strong identity is very important in any line of work. When your brand is strong and distinctive it is seen as a mark of quality and trust. Effective branding is the key factor in attracting long term, loyal clients. Although originally feng shui was applied to physical environments, now it is being applied to the virtual environments as brands and websites. You may have a harmonious feng shui at your office but is your feng shui aligned with your brand? Does your logo comply with good feng shui criteria? During this practical talk you will learn how to use feng shui principles in designing logos and business cards (and even your signature which is your personal logo). Please bring your business cards for assessment.

Jan Cisek (MSc Environmental Psychology) is a leading corporate feng shui consultant working in London with a background in design and branding. Jan has produced many innovative solutions in feng shui, branding and logo design and worked with top brands and corporations. More info about feng shui logo design: http://www.fengshuilogos.co.uk

Watch the 10th Feng Shui Conference (2016) on one page here
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

node.title: Home: How Habitat Made Us Human – John S Allen (USA via Skype link)
node.description:
Home: How Habitat Made Us Human – John S Allen (USA via Skype link)
The 10th Feng Shui Society Conference 14-15 May 2016 London, UK
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

Whether we live in an igloo or in Buckingham Palace, the fact that Homo sapiens create homes is one of the greatest puzzles of our evolution. John S. Allen will present evidence from evolutionary anthropology, neuroscience, the study of emotion, and modern sociology to argue that the home is one of the most important cognitive, technological, and cultural products of our species’ evolution. This presentation will sheds new light on the deep pleasures we receive from our homes, rooting them in both our evolution and our identity as humans. Home is not simply where the heart is, but the mind too.

John S Allen, PhD, is a neuroanthropologist working at the Dornsife Cognitive Neuroscience Imaging Center and Brain and Creativity Institute, University of Southern California. Originally trained in biological anthropology, he received his undergraduate and graduate degrees from the University of California at Berkeley. John’s latest book Home: How Habitat Made Us Human is available on Amazon/Kindle

Watch the 10th Feng Shui Conference (2016) on one page here
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

node.title: The Five Aesthetic Principles of Feng Shui – Howard Choy (Germany)
node.description:
The Five Aesthetic Principles of Feng Shui – Howard Choy (Germany)
The 10th Feng Shui Society Conference 14-15 May 2016 London, UK
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

Feng shui belongs to the Art of Observation (Xiang Shu) in the Taoist Five Arts, consequently the aesthetics of a place or a built-form become part of feng shui considerations. The aesthetic preferences in feng shui is the main focus of this presentation; you will find out what the SUISY principles are and how they can be applied in feng shui practice. By the end of the talk it is hoped that you will understand the aesthetic criterion to use when someone asks ‘What do you think of the feng shui of this building’?

Howard Choy (Cai Hong), (B.Arch.UNSW) is China-trained in classical feng shui and a practicing feng shui architect (B.Arch.UNSW), based in Berlin. Howard is principal of the European College of Feng Shui (ECOFS) and he is motivated to teach and practice classical feng shui to ensure this living tradition from his birthplace can continue to survive and prosper globally. www.fengshui-college.org

Watch the 10th Feng Shui Conference (2016) on one page here
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

node.title: The Four Pillars of Destiny – Raymond Lo (Hong Kong)
node.description:
The Four Pillars of Destiny – Raymond Lo (Hong Kong)
The 10th Feng Shui Society Conference 14-15 May 2016 London, UK
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

The Four Pillars of Destiny is a Chinese system using the five elements present at the moment of birth. As such, when an event happens we can examine the Four Pillars at that particular point in time. The presence of elements and their interactions reveal to us a picture that gives alternative clues about what might occurred then. This talk will provide many examples of how the five elements model can shed light on particular events and how the Four Pillars can offer another explanation for a person’s situation.

Raymond Lo, popularly known as “Fung Shui Lo”, is a feng shui and destiny consultant, author and lecturer. He has written over 12 books on feng shui, Four Pillars of Destiny and I Ching divination ((including “Feng Shui and Destiny”). He has appeared on numerous international television shows and in media interviews. He conducts a popular Feng shui Practitioners Training Program. www.raymond-lo.com

Watch the 10th Feng Shui Conference (2016) on one page here
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

node.title: Feng Shui Tips from Scandinavia – Susanna Utbult (Sweden)
node.description:
Feng Shui Tips from Scandinavia – Susanna Utbult (Sweden)
The 10th Feng Shui Society Conference 14-15 May 2016 London, UK
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

Scandinavia consists of Sweden and Norway (sometimes also Finland and Denmark) and has a unique style of feng shui. One size doesn’t fit all when it comes to applying feng shui. To make feng  shui work in Scandinavia we need to take the climate into consideration. Seven months of the year are cold and dark.  In this presentation, Susanna will show how the Scandinavian people, have interpreted feng shui for hundreds of years and also show how feng shui is used for contemporary living in Scandinavia.

Susanna Utbult is the founder of Nordic School of Feng Shui and the co-founder of the Swedish Feng Shui Association. Susanna has studied feng shui for the last seventeen years. Susanna has been teaching feng shui since 2004. In addition to teaching, Susanna also works as a consultant, using feng shui, to plan and develop business and homes. More info: www.nordic-fengshui.com

Watch the 10th Feng Shui Conference (2016) on one page here
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

node.title: Auspicious Date Selection – Norbert Syncak (Slovakia)
node.description:
Auspicious Date Selection – Norbert Syncak (Slovakia)
The 10th Feng Shui Society Conference 14-15 May 2016 London, UK
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

Auspicious dates are selected for important personal or feng shui activities such as marriages, job applications, business transactions, signing of agreements, constructions and reconstructions, moving in to the house, installation of internal and external features and other events. This talk will be focused on application of various date selection technics (ZE RI art). The real case studies will explain the effect of “Acupuncture of time and space” to the life events and tips and tricks for fast finding the universal auspicious dates with excellent quality of qi.

Norbert Syncak is the founder and principal of Academy of Chinese Metaphysics (Slovakia), trained in the classical feng shui (Malaysia), classical Chinese medicine and acupuncture – Wu Yun Liu Qi and five element style with application of BAZI in acupuncture. He devoted last 25 years to sharing his knowledge in training, workshops and international congresses. www.tradicne-feng-shui.sk/

Watch the 10th Feng Shui Conference (2016) on one page here
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

node.title: The Influence and Value of Feng Shui in the Modern Built Environment – Manuela Madeddu (UK)
node.description:
The Influence and Value of Feng Shui in the Modern Built Environment – Manuela Madeddu (UK)
The 10th Feng Shui Society Conference 14-15 May 2016 London, UK
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

All civilisations have left an imprint on the world around them which invariably expresses particular belief systems and cultural norms. These can be identified in the fabric of every city, every town and indeed any landscape that is a product of human contrivance. This talk spotlights feng shui as a belief system with a pervasive influence on many cities and urban spaces, drawing on the value of feng shui as a paradigm that promotes harmony between man and nature. 

Manuela Madeddu, (PhD) is senior lecturer in planning and housing at London South Bank University. Recently her teaching and research has been focused on housing development, the design of places and the quality of new homes. An architect and urban designer, she was in architectural practice in Italy and has worked in urban design in the UK. More about Manuela Madeddu / www.marvarchitettura.com

Watch the 10th Feng Shui Conference (2016) on one page here
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

node.title: Electrosensitivity: Non-ionising Radiation, Practical Solutions - Dr Erica Mallery-Blythe (UK)
node.description:
Electrosensitivity: Non-ionising Radiation, Practical Solutions to Improve Health – Dr Erica Mallery-Blythe (UK)
The 9th Feng Shui Society Conference 9-10 May 2015 London, UK

http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-9th-feng-shui-society-conference-9-10-may-2015-london-uk/

More and more people are becoming electrosensitive and there is a growing body of research on this subject now. Electromagnetic pollution is now regarded as one of the top pollutants and stressors of modern life. Learn what is electrosensitivity, how it can affect your health and well-being and how to protect yourself or if you’re already electrosensitive what to do about it.

Watch the feng shui conference on one page here
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-9th-feng-shui-society-conference-9-10-may-2015-london-uk/

node.title: Enhancing the Peach Blossom in Our Lives – Dr. Jin Peh (China) 9 FSS Conference 2015 London, UK
node.description:
Enhancing the Peach Blossom in Our Lives – Dr. Jin Peh (China)
The 9th Feng Shui Society Conference 9-10 May 2015 London, UK

http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-9th-feng-shui-society-conference-9-10-may-2015-london-uk/

In Chinese culture, the term Peach Blossom signifies romance. In this talk, we will look at the role of romance and relationships in Chinese culture, as well as the traditional symbols of romance. Practical feng shui tips on improving the romance in your lives will also be introduced and common misconceptions pointed out. The talk will conclude with how to assess the potential of Peach Blossom in your life from the Chinese Astrology chart.

Watch the feng shui conference on one page here
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-9th-feng-shui-society-conference-9-10-may-2015-london-uk/

node.title: Using Ming Gua Directional Preferences in Architectural Design – Kristiina Mäntynen (Finland) 9 FSS
node.description:
Using Ming Gua Directional Preferences in Architectural Design – Kristiina Mäntynen (Finland)
The 9th Feng Shui Society Conference 9-10 May 2015 London, UK

http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-9th-feng-shui-society-conference-9-10-may-2015-london-uk/

Houses are usually planned to ”fit for all”. However, if a house is built for a particular family, the Ming Gua directional preferences of the occupants can be used to guide the design process. In her presentation Kristiina will show how she has done that in the houses she has planned.  The same principles can also be easily applied when we look for the ideal placement and directions in existing living spaces.

Watch the feng shui conference on one page here
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-9th-feng-shui-society-conference-9-10-may-2015-london-uk/

node.title: Pactical Feng Shui Tips from Japanese, Korean and Chinese Gardens – Victor H. Garza (China) 9 FSS 15
node.description:
Pactical Feng Shui Tips from Japanese, Korean and Chinese Gardens that Westerners can Apply in their own Gardens, Patios and Balconies – Victor H. Garza (China)
The 9th Feng Shui Society Conference 9-10 May 2015 London, UK

http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-9th-feng-shui-society-conference-9-10-may-2015-london-uk/

Japanese, Korean and Chinese people have designed gardens for over 1000 years. Whether these gardens are found in a palace, a temple or simply along the streets of an ancient sector of a town or city, these gardens invite us to connect with nature and enjoy the beauty of its arrangement by walking along its paths, bridges, pavilions or pagodas appreciating its flowers, plants, trees and water. A few of the key elements from those gardens could be incorporated in your own garden, patio or terrace making your home or office a small natural sanctuary.

Watch the feng shui conference on one page here
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-9th-feng-shui-society-conference-9-10-may-2015-london-uk/

node.title: Connecting Feng Shui with Nature: Greening the City – Gary Grant (UK) 9 FSS Conference 2015 London
node.description:
Connecting Feng Shui with Nature: Greening the City – Gary Grant (UK)
The 9th Feng Shui Society Conference 9-10 May 2015 London, UK

http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-9th-feng-shui-society-conference-9-10-may-2015-london-uk/

Essentially feng shui is a pro-environmental practice, so how can it help to improve built-up congested neighbourhoods?  Gary Grant will present an ecological approach to urban greening, where nature is brought into our towns and cities in order to increase wellbeing, reduce air and noise pollution, lower temperatures in heat waves and reduce flood risk. He will describe a number of initiatives, including green roofs, living walls and rain gardens in London and inner city locations elsewhere in the world. These systems can be functionally incorporated into urban feng shui projects.

Watch the feng shui conference on one page here
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-9th-feng-shui-society-conference-9-10-may-2015-london-uk/

node.title: The Three Lucks: Heaven, Human, Earth – Laurent Langlais (UK) - 9 FSS Conference 2015 London, UK
node.description:
The Three Lucks: Heaven, Human, Earth (The Taoist View on Feng Shui and Life) – Laurent Langlais (UK) 
The 9th Feng Shui Society Conference 9-10 May 2015 London, UK

http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-9th-feng-shui-society-conference-9-10-may-2015-london-uk/

Feng shui is part of a greater system of  Taoism. In Taoism, feng shui is defined as Earth Luck, one of the classical Three Lucks. The other two, Heaven Luck and Human Luck, are our destiny blueprint and our free will. In this presentation, Laurent Langlais will show you how they constantly interact together to define your life. We will see how you can turn your luck around and how your own Qi (life force) informs us about your optimal timing and best feng shui solutions.

Watch the feng shui conference on one page here
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-9th-feng-shui-society-conference-9-10-may-2015-london-uk/

node.title: Colour Psychology: The Energy of Colour – Angela Wright (UK) 9 FSS Conference 2015 London, UK
node.description:
Colour Psychology: The Energy of Colour – Angela Wright (UK)
The 9th Feng Shui Society Conference 9-10 May 2015 London, UK

http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-9th-feng-shui-society-conference-9-10-may-2015-london-uk/

Colour psychology is the effects of the electro-magnetic radiation of light on human mood and behaviour – a universal, psychophysical reaction, which is not as heavily influenced by culture, age and gender as is generally thought. There is a great difference between colour psychology and colour symbolism. Historically, what is often described as colour psychology is actually colour symbolism – the conscious associations that we are conditioned to make. Cultural responses to colour derive from a variety of causes: for example, green is the sacred colour throughout Islam, being the colour of the Prophet’s robe; in Ireland it is considered lucky, perhaps because when the world around us contains plenty of green this indicates the presence of water and therefore little danger of famine; in England it is considered unlucky, possibly because of its association with decay and disease. During the talk you’ll learn about colour and the energies behind it and its profound effect on human behaviour and why colour is the most influential element in the design mix and therefore in feng shui.

Watch the feng shui conference on one page here
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-9th-feng-shui-society-conference-9-10-may-2015-london-uk/

node.description:
什麽是奇門遁甲？
影片中，我們將探討奇門遁甲為何能幫助你策劃精密的商業戰略，讓你在業務上更上一層樓。

------------------------------------------------

憑借著專業的態度及深厚的風水命理根基，羅一鳴師傅成為多家跨國企業的禦用風水顧問，同時也參與了諸如馬來西亞伊斯幹達經濟特區重點發展事項、城鎮花園規劃及寮國賭場等大型發展項目。

特出的雙語能力使羅師傅與其他一般只能以單語的風水師傅們立於不同的水平線上，加上出色的口才與淵博的風水知識，羅師傅備受許多大型活動和商業機構青睞，成為許多風水講座的特邀嘉賓兼講師。

隨著多年的實戰經驗，羅師傅成立了龍巖風水命理學院，通過公司團隊的力量為大眾提供最專業的風水及命理服務。羅師傅也成功獲得國際認證ISO9001，成為全馬第一間獲得國際認證的風水公司！這些年來，羅師傅傳授了風水知識給數百位來自馬來西亞、新家坡、印尼及中國的學生，一些學生後來也成為了精通風水命理的風水顧問。

毋庸置疑，羅一鳴師傅是風水界裡首屈壹指兼擁有良好口碑的風水學家，接下來的日子羅師傅將繼續將風水命理知識靈活運用並傳承下去，發揚光大！
